newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIAN CUSTOMS SEIZE HEROIN DURING SOCCER.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIAN CUSTOMS SEIZE HEROIN DURING SOCCER.

text.p: Bulgarian customs officers said on Thursday they had seized 23.46 kg of heroin hidden in a car which tried to sneak across the border during Bulgaria's World Cup soccer qualifier against Cyprus on Wednesday night.

Customs spokesman Ivan Kutevski said a Mercedes car with two Turks was stopped at the Danube port of Rousse as it tried to cross to Romania. He said 46 packages of heroin were found hidden under the chassis and in the wheel arches.
The smugglers had apparently hoped border police would be watching the match. Bulgaria, which is on the so-called Balkan route for smugglers bringing drugs into western Europe, beat Cyprus 4-1.
